titles.title: To permit increased local management and control of Fullbright Park, a city park in the City of Union Gap, Washington, that was purchased in part with monies from the land and water conservation fund.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.

bill.summary: 3/27/1998--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of the Interior to unilaterally release all terms and conditions imposed with respect to certain Federal contributions for the acquisition and development of Fullbright Park in Union Gap, Washington, a completed land and water conservation fund project owned and managed by the city of Union Gap. Requires, as part of such release, that the Park continue to be used for public recreation. Prohibits such release from affecting the rights of the Yakima Indian Tribe with respect to Park use.
